intro: Bossiaea webbii, commonly known as the Grey Bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a small, shrub-like species that typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pink or red in color. It is part of the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves. Bossiaea webbii is often found in heathlands and is adapted to withstand drought and poor soil conditions.
